MARK: Look no further, Doctor Farrer.
HEX: (sotto) McShane. Mark.
FARRER: Garnier, what is this?
ACE: What do we look like?
GARNIER: Your organ donors, Doctor.
ACE: Now, wait a minute!
MARK: Hey, hey, you can't do this. You Argh!
POLK: Resistance is futile.
FARRER: Garnier, these are people. Living people. You can't expect me to just render them down.
GARNIER: Oh? When did you get so picky? All the other organs for the recarnative programme came from people too, Doctor.
FARRER: Yes I know, but from casualty victims, the brain-dead, bodies that would not otherwise live. This is, this is tantamount to murder.
GARNIER: As I understand it, Doctor Farrer, two of our very special guests will flat-line from chronic organ failure in the next thirty minutes. The Euro-Combine is dedicated to maintaining our cooperative links with the Cyber-race. You will operate. You will save their lives.
FARRER: By murdering this young man and this young woman?
GARNIER: I authorise it by the Emergency Powers. Polk, strap them down.
ACE: Ow!
MARK: Ow!
ACE: Ow!
FARRER: David, where is your soul? I can't do this!
GARNIER: I have a signed contract that says otherwise, Stephen. Harvest and be damned.
ACE: Oh, you really are thick, aren't you, David?
GARNIER: I don't think you're in any position to comment, Ms McShane.
FARRER: I won't do it.
MARK: You tell him, Doc!
GARNIER: You will. And I'll leave Cyber-human Parsons here to ensure you do. Twenty five minutes and counting, Doctor.
ACE: Doctor Farrer, you don't have to do this.
MARK: For God's sakes, Doctor, you know me. I'm staff.
PARSONS: You will commence the procedure.
FARRER: I will not! Argh!
PARSONS: You will commence the procedure.
FARRER: All right, all right. Start incision cutters.
ACE: You're kidding. No!
MARK: Don't, don't!
ACE: No!
MARK: Oh Jesus. Please!
DOCTOR: Now, I think I might have lost them at last. Mmm. This looks interesting.
SUBJECT ONE: Who is there?
DOCTOR: Oh. Sorry to intrude. Just er, good gracious.
SUBJECT ONE: Who are you?
DOCTOR: I'm the Doctor. Just doing my rounds.
SUBJECT ONE: I am Doctor Farrer's patient. Where is Doctor Farrer?
DOCTOR: Busy. I'm filling in for him. And what matters is who you are, and what you were. A Cyberman.
SUBJECT ONE: Correct.
DOCTOR: But not so Cyber any more. You're flesh and blood. Rather poorly put together, if I may say so.
SUBJECT ONE: This is a prototype graft body.
DOCTOR: Which would explain the sutures and the swellings and the bits that, that don't quite work.
SUBJECT ONE: There will be revisions.
DOCTOR: I hope so. What was your rank?
SUBJECT ONE: Cyber Leader.
DOCTOR: Cyber Leader. As senior as that? And here you are, swapping cyber for flesh. Care to comment?
SUBJECT ONE: You seem curiously uninformed. If you are one of Doctor Farrer's associates, why have you not been briefed?
DOCTOR: Ah, well, er, that's confidential, I'm afraid, and
GARNIER: Ah, the notorious Doctor.
DOCTOR: Oh, I don't know about notorious.
GARNIER: Polk, kill him.
DOCTOR: Ah!
POLK: Resistance is futile.
ACE: Farrer!
MARK: Dear God!
ACE: For pity's sake, Farrer!
MARK: Dear God, please!
FARRER: I can't do this.
PARSONS: (sounding Cyberman) You will comply.
FARRER: Ah! Sorry. I'm so very sorry.

elements.text: [Part Four]
Stop it. Stop it!
Hex? Hex!
Stop it! Let them go.
Do not interfere. Threats to the programme will be eliminated.
Farrer! Help me, for God's sake!
Let him go. You'll snap his neck.
Threats to the programme will be eliminated.
Whirring, Parsons gurgles.
System, shut down the auto-surgeons, now.
Yes, Doctor Farrer.
Oh. Oh, thank God. Are you all right, Mathias?
Just get me off this bloody bench.
You cut his head off.
Yes. I wasn't sure the bone saw was going to go right through. All that work.
Never mind that, Doctor. Help me get these two free. Come on, McShane. You okay?
Not the most fun I've ever had. Thanks, though. Nice save.
Up you get, Doctor Mathias.
Uh-huh. Doctor Farrer?
Yes. (thump) Argh!
You were going to kill us!
Mark! That's enough, Mark.
You were going to cut us apart!
Leave him alone, Mathias. He's not worth it. Get up, Farrer.
We have to get out of here.
We're not finished here yet.
You don't understand. The prototypes are all linked by a transmission network. They will all know that something's happened to, well, Parsons here, and they won't be very happy about it.
Alarm starts.
That's not good.
See? I can probably get us to the main exit. My log-tag has clearance.
Hex, how did you get in here?
A little blue box.
The Doctor's with you?
He was, but we got separated. Just hope he's okay.
The Doctor groans.
Resistance is futile.
Wait. Do not kill him, Polk. He is useful to us.
What are you talking about? He's a spy, he's a foreign agent.
More foreign than you can imagine, Executive Security Officer Garnier.
Ah. So you do recognise me.
I no longer have access to my data archives, but, I remember. The Doctor is coded into the engrams of all Cybermen. You have been a singular opponent of Cyber-kind.
Credit where credit's due. Someone has to be. Of course, I'm entitled to try to stop you. I mean, after all, although I am ashamed to admit it, it's my fault your race survived in the first place.
This is all nonsense. He's a security hazard and he must be
System, scan the Doctor's bio-template.
Subject does not fit fundamental biological patterns. The Doctor is not human.
In the present circumstances, that's a fact I'm rather proud of.
He's an alien?
A Time Lord. One of a breed of meddlers. But his mind contains extensive and advanced technical knowledge.
You're too kind.
Apt then that you will help us now. You will use your superior knowledge to compensate for this world's rudimentary surgical skill. You will finish the recarnative work.
And make you and your kin living flesh?
Is this true? Are you some kind of expert?
Oh, some kind.
The recarnative programme is in jeopardy. Under the powers of the 2021 Euro-Combine Special Provisions Act subsection nine, I am co-opting you to assist the needs of this facility.
(laughs) I don't take orders from petty bureaucrats, Mister Garnier. I certainly don't take orders from weak men desperate to protect their careers and save their own hides.
You will comply!

No I will not! Have you any idea how misbegotten this enterprise is? Have you any conception of the danger you're manufacturing within these walls? Your beloved Euro-Council superiors won't praise you for this, Garnier. They won't even remember you as a loyal servant of the Combine. And you know why? Because they'll all be soulless silver monsters marching to a sterile alien logic along with you and the rest of humanity!
You will comply, Doctor. You will cooperate with Euro-Council directives.
Why? Because resistance is useless? Listen to yourself, Garnier. You don't even need the implants.
You will comply, or Polk will dismantle you.
Polk? He's a fine fellow. But he seems to me a little distracted.
What? What's the matter, Polk?
There is an alert in the harvesting lab. Cyberman Parsons has ceased transmitting.
Well, the others will deal with it.
The programme must be protected.
I said leave it to the others, Polk.
The programme must be protected.
You'll find once you've given them an order, they're very single-minded.
Very well, Polk. See to the alert.
Gun loaded.
I'll handle this.
Oh, how very Humphrey Bogart, Mister Garnier.
Be quiet. Polk? You and the other prototypes have access to the weapons locker. Authorisation Garnier 1725 D. Protect the programme.
I will.
Walking off. Door slides open, closed.
I really don't think that was such a good idea.
I don't care what you think.
Then care what I know. If you expect me to help you, Cyber Leader, you'd better bring me up to speed, fast.
Very well, Doctor.
Good. First then, how did you come to be here on Earth?
That's classified.
I was in command of a small expeditionary force, Doctor, myself and six units. There was a malfunction and we crashed.
How unfortunate. Where?
A mountainous region.
In the Pyrenees. Euro-Council team secured the site.
And decided to help yourselves to the advanced technology.
Well, they were hurt. Well, damaged. We provided them with aid, every resource at our disposal. In return, they offered us technical advancements to

To accelerate your space programme. Oh, don't look so surprised, Mister Garnier. I worked that much out myself. You're borrowing Cyber-tech to create a new generation of post-human astronauts. And that much I understand. Typical misguided human ambition. Oh, I've seen it so many times before, sadly. Confronted with wondrous toys you can't stop yourself playing with, and all the while the oh-so-logical voice of the Cyberman telling you it's okay, telling you cybernisation is a good thing. But in return? Why flesh?
We have wearied of our cold existence.
Oh really? My hearts bleed.
This world is not Mondas. It is not so frozen and lifeless that only the Cyber-implanted can survive here. It is warm. It is vital. It offers us a chance to enjoy lives of sensation and feeling.
But your so-called cold existence was self-imposed.
By the race, not by us.
What are you saying? You, and your six comrades, you want your organic identities back?
That is all we have asked for, in return for our technology.
I. No. I, I, I doubt you can go back.
The recarnative process the humans are providing here is crude, admittedly, but it
I didn't mean that. It's not just a matter of your physical state. The destructive legacy of the Cybermen casts a long and indelible shadow over everything.
We can try.
I wish I believed you. The notion that even the likes of you can aspire to redemption? But I know the Cyber mind-set. You rejected flesh because it was weak.

We have re-appraised. We have come to realise flesh offers subtle traits that are otherwise denied to us. In its very fallibility, the organic state possesses nuances of thought and behaviour. These are advantages we wish to regain.
Such as?
Individuality. Decision making. Compassion. Appreciation. Interaction. The ability to regard an issue with more than just the binary yes-no of pure logic.
Alert. Subjects Two and Five are suffering serious graft rejection. Assistance required.
Blast. System, find Doctor Farrer.
Doctor Farrer is not answering his pages.
Oh, damn it.
We have the Doctor. He will repair the damage.
Doctor? No more discussion. This way.
Report.
1: One of us has been destroyed.
Is this confirmed?
2: Operational transmissions from Cyber-human Parsons ceased. His non-functioning form has been located in the harvesting facility.
This is a threat to the programme.
1 + CYBERMAN 2: The programme must be protected.
Threats to the programme will be eliminated. System will now open security weapons locker. Authority Garnier 1725 D.
Authority recognised. Locker enabled.
Secure the area. Protect the programme. Threats to the programme will be eliminated.
Door slides open and closed.
Should there be alarms ringing all over the place?
It's a security matter, not your concern, Doctor. This, however, is.
Ah ha. Your six comrades, Cyber Leader, suspended in bio-support tanks. And none of them in particularly rude health.
System, provide the Doctor with medical status details of subjects two through seven.
It's on the main display.
All of them are suffering organ failure and serious rejection trauma. They're dying. I'm not sure there's anything I
Please, Doctor.

It disturbs me to hear myself say this, Cyber Leader, but I am sympathetic. This tragically belated attempt to recover your lost humanity is remarkable. It's heartening to see there is still hope even in the most hopeless cases. But as to what I can practically do?
You can try, Doctor.
Pointing at me with that weapon won't help, Garnier. But shutting down C-Programme and all the active Cyber-humans just might.
Screams, automatic weapons fire.
Threats identified . Threats identified. Resistance is futile. Including threats to the programme. Halt. Do not attempt to escape. Do not attempt to escape. Resistance is
What kind of idiot gave those things guns?
Keep your voice down, Mathias.
It's bloody carnage out there! They're shooting everybody. Nurses, technicians, security pol. Jesus Christ!
Keep the door shut.
Have the Cybermen just flipped out? I mean, they're mowing down all the hospital staff.
Human hospital staff.
What? What does that mean, Farrer?

Garnier commanded them to protect the programme. The Cyber-humans are not enormously subtle. They take commands literally. They know a human destroyed one of them, thereby threatening the programme, and their collective existence, therefore
Therefore what?
Therefore all humans, all non-Cybermen, are a threat to be expunged.
Well, that's just great.
And not a little ironic, seeing as though it was you who killed the Cyberman, Doctor.
I was saving your lives!
Saving our? Let me smack him again!
Mark! Back off.
That is a rather moot point, Farrer. So, where will they draw the line?
What do you mean?
At what point will they stop killing? When they've massacred everyone in C-Programme? On the adjacent floors too. The whole hospital? London?
I don't know!
Can you order them to stop?
Security Officer Garnier has senior authority. I can't countermand his orders.
McShane, what do we do?
I'm thinking.
If we could find the Doctor, we could

Hex, as long as I've been with the Doctor, and you have to believe me when I say that's a surprisingly long time, he's always come through, one way or another. But here, he was so determined to stop this. He was so convinced it was Cybermen, he
What? He what?
Might have done something stupid.
Like what?
Well,. the Doctor can't win every time, can he? I mean, law of averages. Sooner or later something nasty.
I can't believe you're suggesting that.

Then explain that massacre, Hex. You barely know him. I know him. I know the risks he takes, the chances. He can be such a fool. People dying all around, he doesn't stand for that. He'd do something about it, unless
Unless?
Unless he was in a fix. Or he was
Don't.
Travel with the Doctor long enough, there's always that chance.
One chance.
What did he say?
Farrer?
There is one chance.
Spit it out.
There is a provision for this. Right from the start I had misgivings about empowering the post- humans without some kind of safeguard.
Oh, right. Now he's got misgivings.
Let him finish, Mark!

I installed a master cut-out in each of the Cyber-humans, one that could be activated in an emergency. The safeguard's never been armed, but if I could reach my office, I could initialise it and trigger it.
Where's your office from here?
Down the hall, that way, second left, fourth door along.
Out there? We'll never make it.
Door slides open.
We won't know if we don't try.
You expect me to deactivate all the Cyber-humans, Doctor? I don't think so. This is a sanctioned Euro-Combine project.
This is a travesty. These creatures are voluntarily renouncing their evil, and you're merrily creating a new Cyber-threat to replace them.
They're no threat. The Cyber-humans have been manufactured for the good of mankind.
You know, that's just what the Mondasians said.
I am in full control of the Cyber-humans.
Really? Well, what about the alarms? And I think I hear gunfire too.
Doctor, I urge you. My comrades are now suffering chronic deterioration. The monitor shows that one of my own major organs is beginning to fail.
Tell that to Garnier here.
Doctor, please. Don't hold our lives to ransom.
I'm ... I'm sorry. What's it to be, Garnier?
Door slides open and closed. Distant screams.
Polk? What's going on out there?
All threats to the programme are being eliminated.
What do you mean, all threats?
Humans represent a clear threat to the Cybernisation programme. Therefore all humans must be eliminated.
What? But those weren't my orders.
The Cyber-mind loves to take things literally, Garnier.
But
Garnier, the Cybermen are killing everyone. How much more proof do you need?
I mean, I. Polk. Polk, I order you to desist and stand down. Relay that order to all Cyber-human prototypes. Desist and stand down now.
The programme must be protected.
And it will be, but I need you to stop this action. Recognise my authority and stand down.
Authority denied.
What?
Threats will be eliminated.
No! Argh!
Machine gun fire.
Come on!
Move your arse, Mark.
It's just down here.
Oh nuts, they've seen us.
Threats identified.
Hell!
Farrer. Farrer's hit.
Mark, help me get him inside. Lift him, Mark.
Threats identified.
Lock the door. Come on. Seal it.
Will you look at that? I've been shot.
Let me see. You're bleeding freely, but I don't think it's gonna kill ya. Hang on, let me wrap it tight.
Ah! That bloody hurt.
There. You'll do. Now, help me move Farrer.
But it really hurts.
Help him, Mark.
Oh, dear God. Oh, they're trying to get in!
Help Hex! Farrer's shot to pieces.
I've got him. Get on the console, McShane. See what you can do.
Okay.
Right, press here. Here, Mark!
Let him bleed. The guy tried to kill me.
Press here now! We need him alive if we're going to do this.
He's dead, Hex.
No, I've got a weak pulse. Some breath sounds. Clamp that. There.
Hex, I can't get access. Throw me Farrer's log-tags.
Catch.
Ta. I'm in!
Farrer's fading. He's bleeding out. Mark, what do I do?
I, er
You're the doctor! What do I do!
Er, compress here. No, here, numb-nuts. Er, plug that wound and, and keep him breathing.
Okay. Okay.
I've found it. I've found the safeguard.
Mark. What now? Mark! Damn it, he's passed out.
Oh no.
What's the matter?
The safeguard requires a password.
Threat eliminated.
And I am next, I suppose?
You will cooperate.
What?
You will cooperate with the Cyber Leader.
Oh, no. All that fine talk about redemption. It was just a lie, wasn't it?
The subtle benefits of an organic mind have proved useful, Doctor.
You've been in control of them all along.
Cyber-kind has overcome its one fundamental weakness. The rigidity of its logical thought process.

A bravura performance. You've established a Cyber-processing factory in the heart of one of the Earth's most densely-populated cities. Equipped it with a new generation of sophisticated free-thinking leaders. So, how long?
Before total global conquest? We estimate six Earth weeks. This facility alone contains the raw materials for thirty thousand Cybermen. It is a foothold that will not be lost.
Curse you, and curse me for being
You will commence repair surgery on the recarnative subjects.
Oh, will I?
You will cooperate with the directives of Cyber-command.
I think not.
Resistance is useless.
Sometimes, Cybermen, resistance is all that counts.
Do not force him to kill you, Doctor. Repair our flesh. Your life will be spared in exchange for your help.
(laughs) Forgive me, Cyber Leader, but I know now you're capable of lying. You'll kill me even if I do help you. So, the answer has to be no.
Hex? Hex, they're nearly through the door.
Farrer. Doctor Farrer. Can you hear me? Come on! Farrer. Stay with me. Stay with me. Don't dare flat- line on me now.
Hex?
Farrer, the password. What's the password? Please! (CPR) One-two-three, Two-two-three, three-two- three. Farrer! Please.
Har vest.
Harvest. The password's Harvest.
Door slides open.
Threats located.
Last chance, Doctor.
Hmm? Yours or mine?
Polk, kill the Doctor.
Cry, thud
Polk? Polk! What is your malfunction? Answer me.
He looks fairly fried to me.
Polk, respond.
System, what is the status of the Cyber-human prototypes?
All Cyber-human prototypes have been terminated.
No!
Information is correct. All Cyber-human prototypes have
Noooo!
Deny it all you like. Someone just put a crimp in your plans.
This was not predicted!
Not by you, maybe. Me, I'm going to go and shake the person responsible by the hand.
Doctor, you're just going to walk away?
Yes, I think so. There are bound to be some loose ends, I suppose, bound to be. But we're all done here, aren't we?
I
Something on your mind, Cyber Leader?
I am experiencing pain. Pain and fear. Our organs are failing. You must help us. You must help me.
Oh, really?
I am dying.
Ah yes. The flesh is weak, isn't it?
Beep becomes a continuous tone.
Attention. Emergency evacuation underway. Please exit the hospital. Help is on its way. Repeat. Attention. Emergency evacuation underway. (continues under dialogue)
Ace? Mister Hex?
Doctor. There you are.
Are you all right?
Yes.
Help is on its way.
All things considered. My, it's a mess in here. They all but took that hatch off its hinges, didn't they? Hmm. I see you've been busy.
We pulled the plug on ‘em.
I had rather presumed you were behind it.
Actually, it was McShane.
Oh, be fair. It was a team effort, Doctor.
Hmm. And, er, Farrer?
I couldn't save him. I tried me best.
I'm sure you did, Mister Hex. And how are you, Doctor Mathias?
Er, seems I've been shot. I don't remember much. Er, who are you?
Time to slip away I think, Ace. The authorities are moving in to secure the hospital. I don't fancy answering any awkward questions right now.
But the xenotech.

I took the liberty of visiting System's data stacks one last time. A lot of valuable data has been wiped. All that the Euro-Combine people will find is a stockpile of machine alloy body parts, no instructions. No one to tell them how it all works.
No one?
Not a living soul.
Are you going?
Yeah. See you some time, matey.
Thanks for your help, Mister Hex.
Okay. Well, it's been. You okay, Mark?
Let's see. I've been shot.
But you'll be okay, won't ya? Until the paramedics get here?
Yeah. I suppose so. Why?
l, er, I'll see you later, Mark.
Hex? Hex? Where are you going, mate? Hex?
Help us on its way. Attention. Emergency evacuation underway. Please exit the hospital. Help is on its way. Repeat. (continuing under next scene)
The Tardis. He told me you'd brought it here.
A matter of expediency. We
Doctor! McSh, Ace! Wait!
Mister Hex. Shouldn't you have stayed with your friend?
Mark'll be fine. I Knew that if I didn't hurry, you'd get in that thing and I'd have missed ya.
I'm touched, Mister Hex. But I'm not really very good at goodbyes.
That's just it. Neither am I.
Oh.
I mean - after all this, I was considering a change of career.
Oh yeah?
I had a hunch you might.
Well? What do you think?
I think
You think far too much for your own good, Doctor. I think it's up to Hex. Do you know what you're getting into?
Not even slightly. Isn't that the point?
(laughs) Quite possibly.
Well, you'd better step this way, then, Mister Hex.
Tardis door opens.
Er, Doctor?
Yes?
It's just Hex.
Tardis door closes. The Tardis dematerialises.
Repeat. Attention. Emergency evacuation underway. Please exit the hospital. Help is on its way.
